title: Hypothesis Testing Distributions
text: When conducting a hypothesis test of a single population proportion $$p$$, you must meet conditions for a binomial distribution, where the quantities $$n p$$ and $$n q$$ are greater than $$5$$. q is the complementary probably of succession $$(q=1-p)$$.
speech: When conducting a hypothesis test of a single population proportion  p , you must meet conditions for a binomial distribution, where the quantities  n p  and  n q  are greater than  5 . q is the complementary probably of succession  parentheses, q is equal to 1 minus p  .

title: Hypothesis Testing Distributions
text: The shape of the binomial distribution needs to be a similar shape to that of the normal distribution. In order to assess similarity, we ensure the product of $$n$$ and $$p$$ and the product of $$n$$ and q are both greater than $$5$$.

and q are both greater than   5
